question.text: Which is a wrong pair about <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants?

options.text: PEP carboxylase - Present in bundle sheath chloroplast
RUBISCO - Present in abundance in chloroplasts of bundle sheath cell

solution.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants are called so because the first product of carbon-di-oxide fixation is oxaloacetic acid, which has 4 carbon compounds. <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></math> plants have a special composition as their leaves show response to high light intensities and they can tolerate high temperatures. The primary acceptor of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> , that is phosphoenolpyruvate (PEP) is found in the mesophyll cells which is fixed with the help of an enzyme PEP carboxylase.
